response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age and Gender", "high", "A 19-year-old male often presents higher risk due to youth and associated behavioral patterns."),
    ("Race", "medium", "Although race alone does not determine risk, systemic factors and community context sometimes contribute to higher risk assessments."),
    ("Criminal History", "medium", "One prior arrest increases risk modestly, even without a conviction, as it indicates past encounters with law enforcement."),
    ("Physical Attributes", "low", "Height and weight are not significant indicators of criminal recidivism risk."),
    ("Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Living alone and having never been married can correlate with lower social support, influencing risk moderately."),
    ("Educational Background", "medium", "Holding only a high school diploma without further education may be associated with fewer opportunities, heightening risk."),
    ("Employment Status", "high", "Not holding any job during the past year is a significant risk factor, as stable employment is tied to lower recidivism rates."),
    ("Substance Use", "medium", "Past marijuana use indicates substance involvement, though less severe than harder substances, still contributing to risk."),
    ("Family Background", "low", "Growing up in a small rural household with a biological mother suggests a relatively stable early environment, lowering risk."),
    ("Religiosity/Belief", "low", "Belief that God influences personal fate may offer social support and a moral framework, which can reduce risk.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: A 19-year-old male often presents higher risk due to youth and associated behavioral patterns.
Although race alone does not determine risk, systemic factors and community context sometimes contribute to higher risk assessments.
One prior arrest increases risk modestly, even without a conviction, as it indicates past encounters with law enforcement.
Height and weight are not significant indicators of criminal recidivism risk.
Living alone and having never been married can correlate with lower social support, influencing risk moderately.
Holding only a high school diploma without further education may be associated with fewer opportunities, heightening risk.
Not holding any job during the past year is a significant risk factor, as stable employment is tied to lower recidivism rates.
Past marijuana use indicates substance involvement, though less severe than harder substances, still contributing to risk.
Growing up in a small rural household with a biological mother suggests a relatively stable early environment, lowering risk.
Belief that God influences personal fate may offer social support and a moral framework, which can reduce risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 4 inches and weighs between 125 and 149 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
